str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From nomos; properly, to do by law, i.e. To accustom; by extension, to deem or regard.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of unknown origin; a maiden; by implication, an unmarried daughter.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Past the bloom of youth, of full age. From huper and the base of akmen; beyond the 'acme', i.e. Figuratively past the bloom of youth.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To marry, used of either sex. From gamos; to wed.
